lines.text:
[chasing Joe in the water pipes as he escapes with the antidote]
Wait! Wait, come-come back, you-you stupid fish!

[coldly]
I'm sufficiently intelligent enough to kill you... if you don't stop bothering me.
So what? Any brute could do that. But can you tell me what the square root of... six thousand, five-hundred and sixty-one is?

[stammers]
Uh, three-hundred, divided by forty, minus three is...
[he turns to drink more of the antidote and develops a larger, swollen head]
Ah! Eighty-one!
Yeah! But do you know what happens if an object travels at the speed of light?

[drinks more of the antidote and sprouts spines, legs and arms, and tears his pelvic fins off]
Ah! It turns into pure energy!
What came first, the-the chicken or the egg?

[drinks more of the antidote and grows in size, grows hair and longer limbs, now resembling a fish-human]
It depends on the relative amount of molecules in the universe!
What happens to a fish if he drinks too much antidote?
It...
[wheezes for breath]
becomes... HUMAN!

[coyly]
Can a human breathe underwater?
OF COURSE NOT!
[he realizes he can no longer breathe underwater and drowns, sucked away by the pipe's current]

Once, there was only silence, and not a speck of hope in sight. And every tiny bubble burst on its journey towards the light. But the spark of creation will flicker again, it's a brand new era... about to begin.

[trying to take back the potion from Joe]
I'm convinced your words are true.
Who's this?
Please let me follow you.
What a nice young fish.
I'll hold the bottle, too.
Oh no, that won't be necessary.
I insist, just let me hold it.

[crossly]
The bottle stays with me.
Just let me have a little sip.
No Fly, no! We're at the bottom of the sea, you'll drown!
Hmm... arrest them!
[first lines]

[skateboarding down the hall]
Yee-haw! Going fishing!

[to the crab and Shark]
Useless! The pair of you! You're not fit for sushi! I sentence you to execution!
Uhh... what's that?
Shark! Chew up that useless crab and eat yourself when you've finished!

[about to eat the crab]
Yeh... uh... well...
[turns angrily to Joe]

[realizing his mistake]
Uh... I mean, um, no no, uh, that won't do, ah, my mistake. Nobody has to execute themselves in a civilized society.
[spotting another fish]
You!
Ah, who? Me?
Yes, you! Because of your long and loyal service to me, I hereby appoint you chief executioner.
Ah! Ohh, thank you, sir. Ah, thank you, sir! Thank you, thank you, thank y -
[Shark devours him]
Uh, on the other fin, we could just call it water under the bridge. A great leader is distinguished by his ability to forgive. Shark, I hereby appoint you offensive commander!

[calls the other fish to order]
Atten-tion! Go and get those three infuriating fish and bring them to me *now*!

[after swimming through the potion, the two transform and gain the ability to speak]
What happened?
[realizing he can talk]
Whoa! What's that sound?

[stammering before realizing he can also talk]
Mmm. I believe we have acquired the power of speech, my voracious friend.
Uh...

[slurping up potion]
I can talk. I can think.
[bottling potion]
Mmm, what a delicious beverage. Can you feel the power? Can you... taste it?
Taste it?
[spotting a fish, which he eats]
Ah! Food!
[belching in Joe's face]
Oi! Clean my teeth! There's stuff in the cracks.
Henceforth, oral hygiene is no longer my department.
What?

[flatly]
I don't clean anymore. Try dental floss. From now on, I call the shots. Where there's brain power, I can have fame, fortune, servants.

[Fly and his friends are trapped in a cage with a crab guarding them]
Hey, you! Crab!
It's against military regulations for a guard to converse with prisoners!
You are one poor excuse for a soldier, buddy. Pretty wimpy.
Whaddaya mean wimpy?
A soldier is disciplined, brave, and above all, strong.
What?

[standing in front of cage bar]
Well, for starters, I bet your pathetic claw can't even put a dent in this iron bar.
Oh yeah? Check this out! Watching?
Yeah.
Ready?
Yeah, yeah!

[gets ready to cut cage, but hesitates]
Nah, too easy.

[points to another bar]
Wait, wait, what about this one?
Trivial!
No no, this is the perfect test for your strength. We're talking one hundred percent titanium here.
[the crab decides to snap the key instead]
No, not-not the key!

[driving a larger fish as a bus and addressing another fish]
That will be two clams and five stones, madam.
keep the change.

[clears his throat]
Just a second! These are not valid.
Not valid?
You'll have to get off.
W-what? Chuck, give me your glasses.
[to driver, handing him the lenses of the glasses]
Here, then; have these Transatlantic, Transpacific, worldwide, oceanic-approved deluxe coins.
Very well, then. Here are the tickets.
Hold on. Uh, these two
[gesturing to Stella and Sasha]
are less than six years of age. They ride for free.
Oh. Yes. Of course,
[hands Fly back one lens]
here's a refund.

[gesturing to Chuck]
And this poor fellow is half-blind.
Well...
It's not fair that he should pay full price.
I-I-I-I suppose that's...
And while we're at it, could we sell back the tickets we don't need?
Uh, well, um...
[Fly gives back the unneeded tickets]
Next time, have exact change!

[to Fly]
And what would have happened if it *didn't* work, genius?
